SEARCH
Package it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.rest

Class GameActionsPostRR

java.lang.Object
it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.rest.AbstractRR
it.unipd.dei.webapp.lupus.rest.GameActionsPostRR
All Implemented Interfaces:
RestResource
public class GameActionsPostRR extends AbstractRR
Handles the HTTP POST request to handle game actions. It contains methods to handle both day and night phases of the game.
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
LupusInFabula Group

  • Field Details

    • nightAction

      private static final Map<String,String> nightAction
      Map containing the actions available during the night phase of the game. The key is the role name, and the value is the corresponding action.

    • deadPlayers

      private final Map<String,Boolean> deadPlayers
      Map indicating whether players are dead or alive in the game. The key is the player's name, and the value is a boolean indicating if the player is dead.

    • playersRole

      private final Map<String,String> playersRole
      Map containing the players and their roles in the game. The key is the player's name, and the value is the player's role.

    • nightActionResults

      private final NightActionResults nightActionResults
      The results of the night actions.

    • dayActionResults

      private final DayActionResults dayActionResults
      The results of the day actions.

      The ID of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameActionsPostRR

      public GameActionsPostRR(int gameID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res, DataSource ds) throws SQLException
      Constructs a new GameActionsPostRR object with the specified game ID, request, response, and data source.
      Parameters:
      gameID - The ID of the game.
      req - The HTTP servlet request.
      res - The HTTP servlet response.
      ds - The data source.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL error occurs.

  • Method Details

    • doServe

      protected void doServe() throws IOException
      Processes the game actions received in the request. This method checks the correctness of the actions, handles night and day phases separately, updates the game status based on the actions, and determines the winner(s) if the game is finished.
      Specified by:
      doServe in class AbstractRR
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

    • handleDayPhase

      private boolean handleDayPhase(List<GameAction> gameActions) throws SQLException, IOException
      Handles the day phase of the game, including voting and actions taken during the day.

      This method processes the actions performed by players during the day phase of the game, including voting and special actions based on player roles such as the carpenter's ability, sam's ability, and plague spreader's ability. It also handles errors related to invalid actions.

      Parameters:
      gameActions - A list of GameAction objects representing the actions performed during the day phase.
      Returns:
      true if the day phase actions are processed successfully, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs while accessing the database.
      IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

    • countDeadPlayers

      private static int countDeadPlayers(Map<String,Boolean> deadPlayers)
      Counts the number of dead players in the game.

      This method calculates the number of players who are marked as dead in the provided map of player names and their corresponding status of being dead or alive.

      Parameters:
      deadPlayers - A map where the keys are player names and the values indicate whether the player is dead (true) or alive (false).
      Returns:
      The number of dead players in the game.

    • carpenterCheck

      private boolean carpenterCheck(String player) throws SQLException, IOException
      Checks the ability of a player with the role "carpenter" during a game round.

      This method verifies if the player with the specified username has the role "carpenter" in the current game and if the carpenter's ability is active for the current round. If the conditions are met, the method increments the current sub-phase, records the carpenter's action, and returns true indicating the carpenter's safety for the round.

      Parameters:
      player - The username of the player to check for the role "carpenter".
      Returns:
      true if the player is a carpenter and is safe this round, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs while accessing the database.
      IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

    • correctnessOfDayActions

      private boolean correctnessOfDayActions(List<GameAction> gameActions) throws SQLException, IOException
      Checks the correctness of the actions performed during a game day.

      This method verifies the correctness of the actions performed by players during a game day. It checks various conditions such as whether players and targets are in the game, if players have the correct role, if targets are dead, and the validity of voting actions.

      Parameters:
      gameActions - A list of GameAction objects representing the actions performed during the game day.
      Returns:
      true if all actions are correct, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs while accessing the database.
      IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

    • handleNightPhase

      private boolean handleNightPhase(List<GameAction> gameActions) throws SQLException, IOException
      Handles the night phase of the game by processing the actions performed by players.
      This method evaluates the actions submitted by players during the night phase of the game. It checks the validity of the actions, resolves their effects, and updates the game state accordingly. It processes various actions such as exploration, blocking, protection, mauling, pointing, investigation, shooting, and special actions unique to specific roles. It also handles cases where players target themselves or perform actions that affect other players' actions.
      Parameters:
      gameActions - the list of game actions submitted by players during the night phase
      Returns:
      true if the night phase actions were processed successfully; false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a SQL exception occurs while accessing the database
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

    • wolfCount

      private int wolfCount() throws SQLException
      Counts the number of wolves (including special wolf roles) still alive in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of wolves still alive in the game
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the SQL statement

    • correctnessOfNightActions

      private boolean correctnessOfNightActions(List<GameAction> gameActions) throws SQLException, IOException
      Checks the correctness of the actions performed during the night round.
      This method verifies the correctness of the actions performed by players during the night round. It checks whether the player and target are in the game, if the player has the correct role, if both the player and target are alive, and if the actions correspond to the roles' abilities. Additionally, it ensures that the correct number of actions is performed by each role with an effect.
      Parameters:
      gameActions - the list of game actions to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the actions are correct, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a SQL exception occurs while accessing the database
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

    • actionCheck

      private boolean actionCheck(Map<String,Map<String,Boolean>> actionsMap, Map<String,String> playerRole) throws IOException
      Checks the validity of night actions performed by players ensuring that the target of each action is valid for the corresponding player role.
      Parameters:
      actionsMap - a map containing player names as keys and maps of actions as values
      playerRole - a map containing player names as keys and their corresponding roles as values
      Returns:
      true if all actions are valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

    • getActionsMap

      private Map<String,Map<String,Boolean>> getActionsMap(List<GameAction> gameActions, Map<String,String> playerRole) throws IOException, SQLException
      Generates a map of actions performed during the game round. This method constructs a map where each player is associated with a map of actions. The map of actions represents if the player associated with it is targeted by some action. If he's targeted then the map of action will have the corresponding value of that action set to true, false otherwise.
      It considers special cases for certain roles, such as Dorky, Puppy, and Explorer, and updates the action map accordingly.
      Parameters:
      gameActions - a list of GameAction objects representing actions performed by players
      playerRole - a map containing player names as keys and their corresponding roles as values
      Returns:
      a map of actions to be performed by players during the game round
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
      SQLException - if a SQL exception occurs

    • getVotesMap

      private Map<String,Integer> getVotesMap(List<GameAction> gameActions)
      Utility method to initialize a map representing player votes.
      Parameters:
      gameActions - a list of GameAction objects containing player information.
      Returns:
      a Mapinvalid input: '<'String, Integer> where the keys represent player names and the values represent the initial vote count (0).

    • updatePlayerDeath

      private void updatePlayerDeath(String player) throws SQLException
      Updates the information about a player's death in the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The username of the player who died.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

    • isAVictory

      private VictoryMessage isAVictory() throws SQLException
      Determines if the game has reached a victory condition.
      Returns:
      a VictoryMessage indicating the result of the victory condition and the winning players:
      • "The Evil roles win the game" if Evil wins.
      • "The Hamster wins the game" if Hamster wins.
      • "The Good and Neutral roles win the game" if Good and Neutral win.
      • "The Jester wins the game" if Jester wins.
      • null if no victory condition is met.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error accessing the database.

    • getPlayerByRole

      private GameAction getPlayerByRole(List<GameAction> gameActions, String name)
      Retrieves the game action associated with the specified role from the list of game actions.
      Parameters:
      gameActions - The list of game actions to search.
      name - The name of the role to search for.
      Returns:
      The game action associated with the specified role, or null if not found.
